title: Console_TEST creates a bunch of garbage directories in the home directory

content.raw:
It seems that the unit test `Console_TEST` creates a bunch of garbage directories with randomized names in the home directory of whatever user runs the test. To call this annoying would be an understatement. I haven't looked much into what exactly the test is doing, but could we either

* Have the test clear the directories after they are no longer needed

and/or

* Create the directories in an isolated directory (maybe something like `~/ign-test/`) where they will not clutter the user space? That way in the worst case scenario, the user only has to delete one directory instead of cherrypicking through the home directory to clear out the garbage?
